item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Prayagraj police have set up extensive security measures as over 45 crore visitors are expected to attend the Mahakumbh, which occurs once every 12 years.

  • Comprehensive security measures include a circular security system with 102 checkpoints along key routes, vehicle checks, and individual frisking.
  • More than 1,000 police personnel are deployed, supplemented by 71 inspectors, 234 sub-inspectors, and 645 constables.
  • Security resources also include 10 drones, 5 Vajra vehicles, and several anti-sabotage teams.
  • A multi-layered security system termed “impenetrable security chakravyuh” protects critical installations like temples and akhadas.
  • Innovative technologies, such as 2,700 AI-enabled cameras and 113 underwater drones, have been incorporated.
"We are committed to ensuring the safety of all participants," said DGP Prashant Kumar.

The Mahakumbh will span from January 13 to February 26, with major rituals scheduled on auspicious days, attracting millions of pilgrims to the holy Sangam.

item.title: 'Such arrogance is not good': Tamil Nadu governor slams CM MK Stalin over national anthem row - The Times of India
item.description:
'Such arrogance is not good': Tamil Nadu governor slams CM MK Stalin over national anthem row

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Tamil Nadu governor criticized Chief Minister MK Stalin regarding the ongoing national anthem controversy, emphasizing the need for respect and unity.

  • The governor highlighted the importance of upholding national values.
  • Stalin's approach to handling the controversy was questioned.
  • Public response has been divided, with various viewpoints on the matter.
“Such arrogance is not good for our national integrity.”

The governor's remarks aim to address the need for a cohesive response to national symbols and unity.

item.title: Pathanamthitta serial sexual abuse case: 28 arrested including minors, SIT deployed - Onmanorama
item.description:
Pathanamthitta Serial Sexual Abuse Case Leads to 28 Arrests, Including Minors

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Local News

The sexual abuse case involving a minor girl in Pathanamthitta has prompted the arrest of 28 individuals as investigations continue.

  • 28 individuals have been arrested, including four minors.
  • A Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed to investigate the case.
  • Seven cases have been registered at the Pathanamthitta police station related to the incident.
  • The survivor, now 18, revealed her ordeal to a community counsellor.
  • The accused befriended the survivor using social media.
"The efforts are focused on collecting scientific evidence, including the examination of mobile phones, to strengthen the case."

The ongoing investigation aims to ensure justice and prevent further incidents of abuse.

item.title: ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates: In trial attempt at docking, SpaDeX satellites successfully come 3 meters to each other, says ISRO - The Indian Express
item.description:
ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates

Date: April 2023 Source: The Indian Express

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) successfully conducted a trial attempt where the SpaDeX satellites came within 3 meters of each other, prior to further data analysis.

  • The docking mission aims to demonstrate in-space docking using small spacecraft.
  • If successful, India will join the ranks of the US, Russia, and China in mastering complex docking technologies.
  • ISRO emphasizes caution due to the complexity of docking two moving satellites.
“Getting it right is more important than getting it done on schedule.”

This mission is vital for ISRO's future ambitions, including lunar sample return missions and the establishment of a space station by 2035.

item.title: Maharashtra: 8 dead, several injured as tempo rams into truck carrying iron rods in Nashik - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Maharashtra: 8 dead, several injured as tempo rams into truck carrying iron rods in Nashik

Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic accident occurred in Nashik, Maharashtra, where eight individuals lost their lives and several others suffered injuries due to a collision between a tempo and a truck carrying iron rods.

  • The accident happened at Dwarka Circle around 7:30 PM.
  • The tempo had 16 passengers returning from a religious event in Niphad.
  • Initial reports indicated that some victims died on the spot, while others were critically injured.
  • Immediate rescue operations were conducted by police, fire brigade personnel, and bystanders.
  • The injured are currently receiving treatment at nearby hospitals, with concerns that the death toll may increase.
“There were 16 passengers in the tempo, which was on its way to CIDCO area here... the tempo driver lost control of the vehicle and rear-ended the truck.” - Police Official

The incident highlights the urgent need for road safety measures, particularly in densely populated areas.

item.title: 6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand - The Indian Express
item.description:
6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Six people died and several were injured after a private bus fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand’s Pauri Garhwal district on Sunday evening.

  • The bus was carrying 28 passengers from Pauri to Dehalchauri.
  • Emergency services were alerted around 4:30 pm when the bus lost control and fell 100 metres.
  • Rescue work was immediately initiated by the State Disaster Response Force and local police.
  • The injured were taken to a district hospital; some were referred to Srinagar hospital.
  • The deceased included Sunita (25), Pramila, Priyanshu (17), Nagendra, Sulochna, and Prem (70).
“The deeply tragic news of the bus accident... I pray to the Almighty to grant peace to the departed souls and give strength to the grieving families.” - Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami

This tragic accident highlights the risks associated with mountainous travel and the urgency for improved road safety measures in the region.

item.title: Five killed as bus falls into 100-metre gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal - The Times of India
item.description:
Five killed as bus falls into 100-metre gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Times of India

A tragic bus accident in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district has claimed the lives of five individuals, adding to the ongoing concerns about road safety in the region.

  • The bus fell into a 100-metre gorge.
  • Rescue operations were initiated immediately following the incident.
  • Authorities are investigating the cause of the accident.
“We are deeply saddened by the loss of lives in this unfortunate incident,” said a local official.

This incident highlights the pressing need for improved road safety measures to prevent future tragedies.

item.title: PM Modi Motivates Youth To Take Ownership Of 'Viksit Bharat', Warns Against 'Chalta Hai' Attitude - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Motivates Youth To Take Ownership Of 'Viksit Bharat', Warns Against 'Chalta Hai' Attitude

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the need for Indian youth to take ownership of the 'Viksit Bharat' initiative during the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025. He expressed confidence that India’s youth could help elevate the nation to developed status by 2047.

  • Modi urged young people to reject the 'chalta hai' attitude and strive for significant changes in the country.
  • He highlighted the importance of setting and achieving ambitious goals, stating that it is a collective responsibility of all citizens.
  • He recalled Swami Vivekananda’s faith in the youth, asserting that today's youth are pivotal in solving the nation's challenges.
  • Modi mentioned a young athlete’s nickname for him as 'Param Mitra', emphasizing the trust and connection with the youth.
  • The Prime Minister affirmed that with unified efforts, no power can stop India's progress.
“Setting and achieving big goals is not just the work of any one government machinery; it is a must that every citizen of the country joins it...” - PM Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi's message aims to inspire the younger generation to actively participate in the nation’s development journey towards becoming a fully developed country by the year 2047.

item.title: In BJP’s second list for Delhi Assembly polls, former CM Madan Lal Khurana’s son, MLA axed for Kapil Mishra - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP Reveals Second List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The BJP has announced its second list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, featuring notable political figures, including the son of former Chief Minister Madan Lal Khurana and five women candidates.

  • The list includes 29 new candidates, bringing the total to 58 announced for Delhi's 70 Assembly seats.
  • Former CM Madan Lal Khurana's son, Harish Khurana, is set to contest from Moti Nagar.
  • Kapil Mishra returns to his former constituency, Karawal Nagar, after previously being elected on an AAP ticket.
  • It is anticipated that more women will be included in the final candidate list.
  • Sitting MLA Mohan Singh Bisht has been dropped in favor of Kapil Mishra.
“The seriousness with which the BJP views the upcoming elections can be understood by the point that even sitting councillors have been fielded.”

The ongoing candidate selection reflects the party's strategic approach as the elections approach, aiming for a stronger representation and potential gains in the Delhi Assembly.

item.title: Actors Venkatesh, Rana Daggubati booked for ‘illegal’ demolition of hotel - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Venkatesh and Rana Daggubati Charged Over Hotel Demolition

Date: Jan 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Hyderabad Police have booked Telugu actor Venkatesh Daggubati and three family members for the illegal demolition of Deccan Kitchen Hotel in January 2024, despite a court injunction.

  • The booking follows a local court's directive to file a case against the Daggubati family.
  • Venkatesh’s nephew, Rana Daggubati, and his father and brother were also implicated.
  • Nanda Kumar, the leased property's tenant, claims a loss of ₹20 crore due to the demolition.
  • The property was previously partially demolished by GHMC for being unauthorized.
“Despite an injunction pending from the City Civil Court and against orders from the Telangana high court, the hotel was razed.”

This incident raises significant legal and ethical questions about property rights and the implications of celebrity influence in local governance.

item.title: Snapshots from Maha Kumbh, where all roads lead to the Ganga - The Indian Express
item.description:
Snapshots from Maha Kumbh, where all roads lead to the Ganga

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

All roads in Uttar Pradesh’s Prayagraj lead to the Ganga, especially these days as the Maha Kumbh, a mela hosted here every 12 years, opens its portals on January 13.

  • Hundreds of boats with devotees make continuous circuits of the Triveni Sangam, the confluence of the Ganga, the Yamuna, and the mythical Saraswati.
  • A panoramic photograph of the shore, the brightly painted boats, and the sea of devotees forms a vibrant scene at the river.
This article went live on January twelfth, twenty twenty-five, at thirty-one minutes past five in the evening.

The Maha Kumbh is a significant cultural and religious event, drawing thousands of devotees to Prayagraj and celebrating the deep connections people have with the Ganga.

item.title: Bangladesh summons Indian envoy over border tensions - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Bangladesh expressed its concerns to India regarding border security and recent actions by the Border Security Force (BSF) that have escalated tensions along the Indo-Bangla border.

  • Bangladesh summoned Indian High Commissioner Pranay Verma to discuss border tensions.
  • Allegations were made that India attempted to construct fences at five locations along the border.
  • The Indian envoy emphasized cooperation between BSF and Bangladesh's Border Guard.
  • Recent incidents, including a citizen's killing by BSF, heightened concerns.
  • Bangladesh aims to resolve issues through dialogue rather than conflict.
“Unauthorized attempts to construct fences undermine the spirit of cooperation and friendly relations between the two neighboring countries.” - Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Jashim Uddin

This meeting reflects the ongoing challenges in Indo-Bangladesh relations, emphasizing the need for continued dialogue over border security issues.

item.title: Right is might: Jaishankar to attend Trump inauguration - The Times of India
item.description:
Jaishankar to Attend Trump Inauguration

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar is set to attend the inauguration of Donald Trump as the 45th president of the United States.

  • Jaishankar's attendance signifies the importance of Indo-U.S. relations.
  • He will represent India at a pivotal moment in international diplomacy.
  • The event underscores the ongoing collaboration between the two nations.
“Right is might,” Jaishankar stated regarding India’s stand on global issues.

The upcoming inauguration is expected to draw attention from various global leaders, reflecting the interconnectedness of international politics.

item.title: Assam Rifles vacates post in Manipur, denies villagers’ allegation of harassment - The Hindu
item.description:
Assam Rifles Vacates Post in Manipur Amid Harassment Allegations

Published on: January 12, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Assam Rifles vacated a makeshift post in Manipur’s Kamjong district after a mob destroyed it, protesting alleged harassment by the paramilitary force while supervising timber transportation.

  • The Assam Rifles vacated the Hongbei post following a meeting with local officials and civil society.
  • Villagers protested after they accused the Assam Rifles of interfering in the State Forest Department's matters.
  • Local MLA Leishiyo Keishing stated to the Assam Rifles that their actions were beyond their authority.
  • The Assam Rifles denied the harassment allegations, claiming their operations followed proper procedures.
  • After the protests escalated, the Assam Rifles used tear gas but were unable to prevent the mob from storming the post.
  • Local organizations warned their communities against allowing Assam Rifles personnel to pass through their jurisdictions.
“It is not your duty,” local MLA Leishiyo Keishing reminded the Assam Rifles personnel.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions between the Assam Rifles and local communities amid accusations of overreach and the need for proper oversight in military operations.

item.title: Lohri, Makar Sankranti Bank stock market holidays on 13, 14 January 2025? NSE, BSE open or closed? Trading off or not? Exchanges calendar 2025 - ET Now
item.description:
Understanding Stock Market Holidays on Lohri and Makar Sankranti in 2025

Updated: January 12, 2025 from ET Now

Lohri and Makar Sankranti, celebrated on January 13 and 14, 2025 respectively, will not result in trading holidays for BSE and NSE, which will remain open.

  • Lohri and Makar Sankranti fall on January 13 and 14, 2025, leading to inquiries about stock market operations.
  • BSE and NSE will be operational on both days without any declared trading holidays.
  • These festivals are celebrated across India, with different names and traditions.

“Lohri and Makar Sankranti are not included in the list of trading holidays in 2025,” emphasizing routine trading schedules.

Overall, the stock markets will function as usual during these festival dates, keeping trading hours unchanged.

item.title: Delhi BJP MLA's ‘big mistake’ warning over poll ticket to Kapil Mishra in Karawal Nagar - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP MLA Warns Against Kapil Mishra's Candidacy in Delhi Elections

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht has criticized his party for its decision to grant a ticket to former AAP leader Kapil Mishra for the upcoming assembly elections in Karawal Nagar.

  • Bisht describes the decision as a “big mistake.”
  • He expresses concern over the BJP’s belief that any candidate can win.
  • Bisht will run for re-election from Karawal Nagar, stating he won’t contest from any other seat.
  • There is growing resentment within the BJP regarding ticket distribution, evidenced by protests outside the party office.
“The BJP thinks they will field anyone and he will win. This is a big mistake. Only time will tell what will happen...” - Mohan Singh Bisht

Bisht's critiques point to a broader dissatisfaction with the party's candidate selection process, which he claims favors flatterers over hardworking grassroots members. The situation may have further implications as the election approaches.

item.title: Bangladesh foreign secy meets Indian envoy, expresses concern over killing of citizen, fencing by BSF - ThePrint
item.description:
Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Raises Concerns Over Border Fencing and Killing of Citizen

Publication Date: Recent News

Source: BSS News Agency

In a meeting with Indian High Commissioner Pranay Verma, Bangladesh's Foreign Secretary Md. Jashim Uddin expressed deep concerns regarding recent tensions along the India-Bangladesh border, particularly over border fencing and the killing of a Bangladeshi citizen by the Border Security Forces (BSF).

  • Md. Jashim Uddin met with High Commissioner Pranay Verma in Dhaka.
  • Disputes arose due to unauthorized attempts by the BSF to erect barbed wire fencing along the border.
  • The foreign secretary highlighted a recent incident where a Bangladeshi citizen, Saidul Islam, was allegedly killed by the BSF.
  • Discussions emphasized the need for effective cooperation between the BSF and Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) to combat cross-border crime.
  • The two nations share a lengthy 4,096.7 km border, necessitating various bilateral mechanisms for management.
“The activities particularly the unauthorized attempt to construct barbed wire fencing... have caused tensions and disturbances along the border.” - Md. Jashim Uddin

In conclusion, the meeting underscored the fragile state of India-Bangladesh border relations amid recent violent incidents and the need for constructive dialogue.

item.title: Bangladesh summons Indian High Commissioner over rising border tensions - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Bangladesh faced off with India Sunday over tensions at the border as the neighbouring country’s foreign ministry summoned High Commissioner Pranay Verma to express “deep concern” over “recent activities of the Border Security Force (BSF)”.

This came hours after Dhaka alleged that India was attempting to construct fences at five locations along the Indo-Bangla border, violating a bilateral agreement.

After meeting Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Jashim Uddin, the Indian High Commissioner said: “I just met Foreign Secretary to discuss India’s commitment to ensuring a crime-free border, effectively addressing challenges of smuggling, movement of criminals and trafficking.” “We have an understanding with regard to fencing the border for security. BSF and BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh) have been in communication in this regard. We expect that understandings will be implemented and there will be a cooperative approach to combating crime,” Verma said in Dhaka.

Earlier in the day, Bangladesh Home Affairs Adviser Lt Gen (retd.) Jahangir Alam Chowdhury said that India had halted the construction of barbed wire fencing along the border after strong opposition from the BGB and local residents.

According to the Bangladesh Foreign Ministry, Jashim Uddin told the Indian envoy that the “unauthorized attempt” to construct fences and related operational actions by BSF have caused tensions along the border.

“He emphasised that the construction of barbed wire fences without proper authorization undermines the spirit of cooperation and friendly relations between the two neighboring countries. He hoped that the upcoming BGB-BSF DG Level Talks would be able to discuss the matter at length,” it said in a statement.

“Referring to the recent killing of a Bangladesh citizen at Sunamganj by BSF, Foreign Secretary… strongly resented these acts of killing and called for urgent action by the Indian authorities to stop recurrence of such incidents and conduct enquiries into all these border killings and take actions against those responsible,” it said.

He said Bangladesh believes such issues should be resolved through dialogue.

This article went live on January 12, 2025, at 6:06 PM.

item.title: "Nehru Became PM By Accident," Says Union Minister. Congress Leader Reacts - NDTV
item.description:
Nehru Became PM By Accident, Says Union Minister

Date: January 12, 2025   |   Source: Press Trust of India

During a gathering in Rohtak, Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar stated that Jawaharlal Nehru became India's first prime minister by accident, leading to criticism from Congress leader Bhupinder Hooda.

  • Khattar suggested that Sardar Vallabhai Patel and Dr. B.R. Ambedkar deserved the prime ministerial position over Nehru.
  • Hooda responded by calling Khattar an 'accidental chief minister' and criticized his comments.
  • Khattar emphasized the BJP's efforts to honor Dr. Ambedkar’s legacy, highlighting the establishment of places of respect associated with him.
  • The comments came in light of discussions regarding the memorial for former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh who recently passed away.
  • Khattar expressed confidence in the BJP's prospects for upcoming Assembly polls in Delhi.
“I want to say that Pandit JL Nehru became a prime minister by accident. In his place, someone who deserved it was Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and Dr BR Ambedkar.” — Manohar Lal Khattar

This statement reflects deep political sentiments as India approaches crucial elections.

item.title: Tension in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet after miscreants attack three cows; CM orders probe - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tension in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet after miscreants attack three cows; CM orders probe

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tension gripped Chamarajapet area in Bengaluru after unidentified individuals attacked three cows, severing their udders. The incident has sparked outrage among local residents and political reactions.

  • Incident occurred at Vinayakanagar; cows belonged to local resident Karna.
  • Residents found the injured animals causing outrage in the locality.
  • CM Siddaramaiah ordered investigation and action from the Bengaluru Police.
  • BJP leaders condemned the attack, labeling it a reflection of a 'Jihadi mindset'.
  • Cultural implications discussed regarding the upcoming Sankranti festival.
  • A case has been registered in connection with the incident.
“I have told him to find out those who did it,” - CM Siddaramaiah

The incident highlights rising tensions in the area and raises concerns over animal welfare and community relations. Immediate action from authorities is expected as the situation develops.

item.title: Bangladesh summons Indian High Commissioner over border tensions - The Hindu
item.description:
Bangladesh Summons Indian High Commissioner Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The interim government of Bangladesh has expressed deep concern regarding the ongoing situation along the India-Bangladesh borders. This concern was officially communicated to Indian High Commissioner Pranay Verma following reports of unauthorized border fencing by India.

  • Bangladesh summoned Indian High Commissioner over concerns about border tensions.
  • Foreign Secretary Md. Jashim Uddin conveyed concerns regarding India’s border fencing activities.
  • Officials accused India of not consulting Bangladesh before beginning construction.
  • Bangladesh's government has highlighted past incidents involving the Border Security Force (BSF) and border killings.
  • Preparations for upcoming border talks between BGB and BSF are underway.
“He strongly resented these acts of killing and called for urgent action by the Indian authorities to stop the recurrence of such incidents.”

This summons highlights rising tensions between Bangladesh and India, especially concerning border security and the treatment of citizens across the borders. The situation requires careful diplomatic engagement to prevent escalation.

item.title: GRAP 3 revoked in Delhi-NCR after dip in air pollution levels - The Hindu
item.description:
GRAP 3 Revoked in Delhi-NCR as Air Quality Improves

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: ANI

The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) lifted the ban on certain activities in Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality.

  • The CAQM revoked the restrictions on construction and demolition activities.
  • BS III petrol and BS IV diesel vehicles are now permitted.
  • The decision was influenced by a recent weather change, including rain and a western disturbance.
  • Stage-I and Stage-II restrictions remain in effect.
The Sub-Committee revoke its orders dated 09.01.2025, for invoking actions under Stage-III ('Severe' Air Quality) of the Schedule of GRAP (Revised December 2024), with immediate effect. — ANI (@ANI) January 12, 2025

The lifting of restrictions marks a positive change in air quality in the region.

item.title: 'Big mistake': BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht on party's decision to field Kapil Mishra from his seat - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht Criticizes Party's Decision on Kapil Mishra

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a surprising statement, BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht expressed his concerns over the party's choice to field Kapil Mishra from his constituency, calling it a "big mistake" that could affect party dynamics.

  • BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht has critiqued the party's decision to nominate Kapil Mishra.
  • He termed this move a "big mistake," highlighting potential negative repercussions.
  • Bisht's comments could indicate tensions within the party ahead of upcoming elections.
"This decision may prove detrimental to our party's image and unity," he stated.

This internal dissent illustrates the ongoing challenges the BJP faces as it prepares for the electoral battle, suggesting possible fractures in party cohesion.

item.title: BPSC Row: Supporters Of Pappu Yadav Burn Tyres, Block Roads In Bihar - News18
item.description:
Protest Erupts in Bihar as Pappu Yadav's Supporters Demand BPSC Exam Cancellation

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: News18

Independent MP Pappu Yadav’s supporters protested in Patna, calling for the cancellation and re-examination of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) exam.

  • Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in a demonstration against the BPSC.
  • Pappu Yadav has called for a statewide 'Bihar Bandh' today.
  • This protest follows long-standing demands from aspirants regarding irregularities in the BPSC exam held on December 13, 2024.
“There is no strength bigger than people’s strength.” - Prashant Kishor

As tensions escalated, police detained some protesters. The ongoing protests reflect broader issues surrounding the integrity of the BPSC exams and the concerns raised by candidates.
